      • tag

        public static java.lang.String tag(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Constructs debug TAG strings using a Class, so that rename refactorings will keep the TAG up-to-date. Also handles constructing fully-qualified TAG strings for nested classes.

        Note that this involves a small amount of runtime overhead at start-up, so if your code is particularly performance-sensitive, you may want to stick to a manually constructed TAG string.

        How you use it: 

         class MyClass {
     ...
     private static final String TAG = Utility.tag(MyClass.class);
 }
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class of the class to build a TAG string for
        Returns:
        Fully-qualified TAG string

      • getSpaces

        public static java.lang.String getSpaces(int length)
        Generates a string with length spaces.
        Parameters:
        length - length of the string
        Returns:
        the string

      • logLong

        public static void logLong(java.lang.String TAG,
                           java.lang.String longString)
        Log long string using verbose tag
        Parameters:

        longString - The long string.
